The group is made up of all women who sell vegetables, which is what the group is named after. 

Mrs. Pablina is a member who comments that she works hard day to day in order to get ahead. 

They are asking for this loan to buy vegetables to sell. This way they can keep working and supporting their daily living.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Catherine Njeri

texts.en:
Catherine Njeri is a member of Shakaina Women's Group in Thika, Central Kenya. She is married and has four children ranging in age between three and eleven years old. 

She has a small business near her home where she sells paraffin and is able to earn $5 per day. Through her group, she intends to take a loan to expand her business by stocking solar lanterns. This will increase her income to $8 per day, and the added income will be used to improve the living standards of her family. She will also be able to repay the loan.

Catherine chose to stock solar lamps after attending a training for promotion of renewable energy. With these lamps she hopes to encourage other women to replace their kerosene lanterns with solar lanterns that eliminate smoke, save money, and reduce risk of fires and burns.

loans.use: To puchase solar lanterns for sale

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité  “El Progreso, se conformó con la iniciativa de la señora  Miguela  Actualmente están en el primer ciclo, con doce miembros. El grupo  empezó, demostrando unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; quienes ya cuentan con sus actividades productivas.
Todas ellas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, por ejemplo la Sra. Miguela tiene gallinas, patos, ovejas y demás y con este trabajo ayuda a su familia. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para poder seguir dando buena comida a sus animales.
texts.en:
The committee known as “El Progresso” was started due to the initiative of Sra. Miguela. The group is currently in its first loan cycle with 12 members. The members have begun to demonstrate their unity and solidarity through their friendships. They already engage in productive activities.

All of the members raise and sell farm animals. For example, Sra. Miguela has chickens, ducks, sheep, and other animals. Through her work, she is able to help her family. Miguela is requesting a loan so that she can buy balanced feed in order that she can continue providing a good diet for her animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 31 años es una responsable madre soltera. Vive junto a su hija Jesenia, en una pequeña vivienda que fue heredado por su madre hace 8 años. Agradece a Dios por la madre que tubo, pues ella con su inmenso amor le brindó las herramientas que pueda salir adelante, le heredó su casa y 5 hectáreas de terreno productivo, donde se dedica a la siembra de maíz, papa y alverja. Sus terrenos se sitúan en una zona muy lejana, ella tiene que caminar muchas horas para llegar a cuidar de sus sembríos, que en tiempos de cosechas contrata peones, para que trabajen la tierra junto con ella. Cuenta que es muy rentable su actividad, pues ella misma traslada sus alimentos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Huancayo, donde vende sus alimentos. “Hay fechas en las que tengo que comprar otras cosechas para poder abastecer a mis clientes”, afirma. Por ello su objetivo, es poder convertirse en distribuidora y poder tener mayores ganancias. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Santa Rosa” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, está segura de concretar sus planes, con el apoyo financiero. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. Martha, invertirá el dinero en la compra de más cosechas de alverjas y todo tipo de verduras para su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha, age 31, is a responsible single mother.  She lives with her daughter, Jesenia, in a small home that she inherited from her mother eight years ago.  She thanks God for the mother that she had.  With her immense love, her mother gave her the tools so that she would be able to get ahead.  Martha inherited her house and five hectares of productive land from her mother.  

That is where Martha grows potatoes and peas.  Her land is in an area that is very far, and she has to walk for many hours to get there and take care of her crops.  During the harvest times she hires day workers to work the land with her.  She says this is a very profitable business activity.  She herself transports her food to the wholesale market in the city of Huancayo, which is where she sells her food.

“There are times when I have to buy other harvests in order to be able to stock my customers,” she says.  That is why her objective is to be able to become a distributor and to be able to have greater income.

She belongs to the Santa Rosa communal bank.  This is her second loan with MFP.  She is sure that she will realize her plans with the financial support.  She pledges to make her payments as she did with the previous loan.  Martha will use the loan to buy more pea crops and all types of vegetables for her business.

loans.use: to buy more pea crops and all types of vegetables for her business.

loans.name: 29 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
El comité  29 de Setiembre; Actualmente se encuentran  en el cuarto  ciclo, con quince integrantes, ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas, de escasos recursos, por lo que reciben muy pocas atenciones y beneficios, están muy contentas de encontrar a la Fundación  Paraguaya que las ayuda y las capacita para poder seguir creciendo.
Una de ellas es Mirna, quien ha podido crecer mucho gracias a su grupo, ella se dedica a la cría de animales de corral, y así está saliendo adelante. Comenta que es un trabajo de tiempo completo ya que siempre tiene que estar pendiente de sus animales.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales para seguir dándoles un buen alimento.
texts.en: The committee "29 de Septiembre" ["September 29"] is currently in its fourth loan cycle, with fifteen members. They are very self-sacrificing women, with few resources, and therefore they receive very few services and benefits. They are very happy to have found the Paraguaya Foundation, which supports them to develop themselves through training sessions. One of them is Mirna, who has been able to grow significantly thanks to her group. She works raising farmyard animals, and in this way she is getting ahead. She comments that it is full-time work, since she always has to watch out for her animals. She is requesting this loan so that she can invest it in buying balanced animal feed, to continue giving her animals good nutrition.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sandra, de 32 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es conviviente con Leonidas quien se dedica al transporte, fruto de esa unión tienen 03 hijos de 11, 8 y 3 años de edad a lo que quiere mucho, habitando su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Sandra es la preparación y venta de dulces y una bebida regional denominada como masato que se prepara a base de yuca,  los dulces aprendió a preparar gracias a la enseñanza de su tío, unos deliciosos kekes, rosquillas, pancitos y otros, para luego venderlos de forma ambulatoria caminando por las zonas aledañas, además contando con la ayuda de su tío para preparar y embolsar sus dulces.
Se inicio en este negocio hace más de 06 meses. También vende productos de belleza que compra por catalogo hace más de  08 años.
Considera rentable sus negocios por las buenas ganancias que le deja. 
Le agrada su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para solventar la manutención de sus hijos, además de tener una ocupación ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios y tuvo dificultades para conseguir un empleo, viendo estas dificultades y las necesidades económicas se decidió por iniciar su propio negocio, ahora viendo que  logra terminar sus productos ya que tiene un rápida salida logra ver sus ganancias. Tiene planes de invertir y abrir una fuente de soda en su casa. Este es el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP. Esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además de sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de dulces como azúcar, aceites, harina, almidón, mantequilla y otros a precio por mayor para así tener mejores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra, 32, is a hardworking woman and puts a lot of effort into getting ahead in life. She lives with Leonidas, who works as a driver. They have three children, who are 11, 8 and 3 years old and she loves them very much. They live in their own house.

Sandra makes and sells sweets and a traditional beverage called “masato”, which is prepared with cassava. She learned how to make the sweets thanks to her uncle. She makes cakes, ring-shaped pastry, bread and other things that she sells in the neighboring streets. Her uncle helps her to cook and pack the sweets.

She started this business more than six months ago. She has also been selling beauty products that she buys from catalogues for eight years. She thinks her business is profitable, because of the profits it leaves.

She likes her line of work because she has an income source that helps her support her kids and a job, considering she could not finish her studies and found it difficult to find one. Conscious of these difficulties and the economic needs she had, she decided to start her own business. She sees now that she can have a finished product that is sold quickly, and she can see the profits more easily.

She is planning to open a soda fountain. This is her third loan with MFP. She feels happy knowing that she will have financial support, which makes her feel confident about her business. She enjoys being part of her communal bank and she thinks it is a group where people are caring and close to each other.

With the requested amount, 1000 nuevos soles [PEN], she will buy ingredients for her sweets, such as sugar, different kinds of oil, flour, starch, butter. She will buy these supplies in bulk in order to have a better profit margin.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare sweets, such as sugar, different kinds of oil, flour, starch and butter.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor, de  24 años es un hombre soltero y responsable. Vive en compañía de su mamá Bernardina y su hermano Rubén en casa de su madre desde que nació. A pesar de su corta edad, trabajó con ahínco para tener lo que ahora posee. Terrenos productivos, 5 parcela medianas, además de una moto y un televisor. Sus principales actividades económicas son la agricultura, con la siembra de papa y maíz, los cuales cuida con esmero. Pero su principal actividad económica se centra en la elaboración de leña, que es donde obtiene mayores ganancias, cuenta que vende un promedio de 20 millares en 15 días, esta cantidad varia, ya que depende de la temporada que demoré secar la leña, “en esta temporada de invierno puedo comprar los árboles a menor precio y así esperar el verano para poder vender la leña a buen precio”, menciona. Además desea estudiar, aunque no tenga las posibilidades. Pues vive muy alejado de la ciudad, planea con el tiempo ahorrar lo necesario para lograr su objetivo. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Santa Rosa” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, está seguro de concretar sus planes, con el apoyo financiero. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. 
Víctor; invertirá el dinero en la compra de varios 40 árboles para elaborar leña, ya que en esta temporada de invierno los árboles son más baratos.
texts.en:
Victor is 24 years old.  He is single and responsible and lives with his mother, Bernardina, and his brother Ruben at his mother’s house where he has lived since he was born. Despite his young age he worked hard to have what he now has, productive land, five medium parcels, a motorcycle, and a TV.  His main business is agriculture and he raises potatoes and corn and cares for them with enthusiasm.  His main income generator is firewood which is where he gets most of his earnings.  He tells us that he sells an average of 20 thousand in two weeks.  This business varies because it depends on the season.  “During this winter season I can buy the trees at better prices and wait for the summer to be able to sell the firewood at a good price.”  He also wants to attend school even though he has no possibility of doing so.  He lives too far from the city and wants to save enough over time so that he can achieve his objective.  He is a member of the “Santa Rosa” group and this is its third cycle with MFP.  He is certain that he will be able to solidify his plans with the help of this loan.  He also promises to repay on time as he did with his previous loan.

Victor will use the money from this loan to buy 40 trees to make firewood.  They are less expensive during the winter season.

loans.use: to buy trees.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila de 53 años, está casada Víctor, con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con los 3 menores de 21, 17 y 15 años; en una casa propia ubicada en un distrito rural. Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 22 años, tiempo que ganó experiencia y ahora produce papas y ollucos (tubérculos andinos). Es así que desde muy joven se dedica a las labores del campo y en todo ese tiempo logró adquirir, gracias a su esfuerzo, sus propios terrenos agrícolas, su pequeña casa y ahora ayudar a sus hijos en el estudio. Ahora ellos la ayudan en mantener sus sembríos de papa, arvejas y otras hortalizas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo con su familia.
Sin embargo necesitará de operarios para que la ayuden en la siembra de papas y ollucos. Ella confía que seguirá en su lucha hasta conseguir el dinero para invertir en otros terrenos de cultivos. Por ello requiere de su apoyo para adquirir semillas, para el pago del personal y en la compra de fertilizantes. Éste es su crédito número 9 con MFP. Por esa razón da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando un futuro mejor”, y se siente a gusto de pertenecer a un grupo sólido.
Con los 1500 soles podrá comprar fertilizantes orgánicos y semillas de tubérculos como papas y ollucos.
texts.en:
Teófila, 53, is married to Víctor with whom she has five children but only lives with the three youngest ones who are 21, 17, and 15 years of age in her own house located in a rural district.  She’s worked in agriculture since she was 22-years-old and with this vast experience grows potatoes and ‘ollucos’ (Andean tubers).

She’s been working in the fields since she was very young and in all this time has managed to acquire thanks to her effort her own agricultural fields, her small house and succeeded in raising her children who now help her care for her potato, pea and other vegetable crops.  What she likes best about her work is being able to spend most of her time with her family.  Now, she will be taking care of the potato and olluco crops alone but will hire laborers to help her.

Teófila hopes with this coordinated work to continue striving in her enterprise until she gets enough money to buy more farmland.  She needs your help to buy seeds, pay staff and to buy fertilizer.

This will be MFP loan #9 and she gives her word that she’ll be punctual with her monthly installment payments.  She belongs to the “Mirando un futuro mejor” (Looking at a better future) communal bank and feels good being part of such a solid group.  She will be able to use the 1,500 soles to buy organic fertilizer and seeds for tubers like potatoes and olluco.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and potato and olluco seeds.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Las 16 integrantes de este grupo son muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, es por eso que el grupo lleva por nombre “Mujeres Activas”, ya que eso es lo que son, son mujeres que se esfuerzan día a día y están saliendo adelante.
La señora Hilaria es la tesorera del comité, ella cuenta con un pequeño vivero ubicado en su casa y mediante este trabajo ayuda a su familia y cubre los gastos del día a día. Ella cuenta que le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que las platas es lo que la apasiona, y solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos para el vivero, como ser semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y demás.
Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que reciben nuevamente, ya que les será muy provechosa.
texts.en:
The 16 members of this group are very hard-working and enterprising. For this reason, the group carries the name of "Mujeres Activas” ["Active Women"], since that is what they are: they are women who make an effort day after day, and who are getting ahead in life. 

Hilaria is the committee's treasurer. She has a small plant nursery located at her home, and through this work she helps her family and covers the daily expenses. She reports that she really likes what she does, since plants are her passion, and she is requesting this loan to invest it in supplies for her nursery, such as seeds, compost, fertilizers and other items.

All of them are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving once again, since it will be very helpful for them.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen del Pilar se encuentra en el 6º ciclo con 15 integrantes, son señoras trabajadoras que se esmeran en progresar.
La Sra. Teresita que con esfuerzo para sostener los gastos  del hogar trabaja como empleada doméstica y su actividad secundaria  en la venta de leche con la intención de generar sus propios ingresos trabaja arduamente y así sale adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de leche, para poder seguir trabajando y ganando lo que necesita para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The committee Virgin de Pilar finds itself in its sixth cycle with 15 members who are hardworking women that are doing their best to progress. Teresita, who manages her home expenses with effort, works as a domestic servant and her secondary work is the sale of milk to generate her own income. She works arduously and in this way she moves ahead.

She is asking for this loan for the purchase of milk so that she can continue working and gaining the necessary things to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy milk for sales

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, tiene 53 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, no tiene ninguna relación sentimental desde hace muchos años ya que se ha dedicado siempre a velar por el cuidado de sus 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia que pudo construir durante el tiempo que vivió junto a su ex pareja. Siempre va en busca de nuevas oportunidades y ha aprendido a ser más fuerte con el paso de los años  por las experiencias que le ha tocado vivir.
Nancy es una mujer que disfruta del trabajo, no le gusta estar inactiva es por eso que no desmaya cuanto de realizar alguna labor se trata. Su fuente de ingreso principal consiste en la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Ofrece a la venta arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche, sal, harina y otros artículos. Sus clientes son principalmente sus vecinos a quienes atiende con mucha cordialidad. Lleva en este negocio 5 años, empezó vendiendo en un pequeño quiosco fuera de su casa, ahora tiene una vitrina de exhibición mas amplio en una espacio de su casa que ha destinado para su tienda. Atiende sola o en ocasiones con la ayuda de su hija. También tiene 3 mototaxis que diariamente pone en alquiler y además trabaja como personal de limpieza en una institución del estado. 
Todo lo que realiza le gusta mucho y no duda en poner su mayor esfuerzo para trabajar cada día con mucho optimismo, su gran deseo ahora es mejorar la infraestructura de su tienda para que sus productos se exhiban mejor y pueda vender más. Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, agradece la oportunidad y la ayuda que le brindan las personas para acceder a este financiamiento que le ayudará a mejorar su trabajo, se compromete a pagar puntualmente todas las cuotas y espera continuar trabajando junto a los integrantes de su grupo comunal.
El monto solicitado 1,500 soles lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de abarrotes como azúcar, leche, arroz y huevos ya que estos tienen mayor demanda entre su clientela.
texts.en:
Nancy, 53, is an enterprising and hard-working woman, she has been single for a long time as she has always worked hard to take care of her 4 children. They live in their own home, which she was able to build when she was living with her ex-partner. She is always looking for new opportunities and has learned to be stronger as time has passed thanks to the experiences she has lived through.

Nancy is a woman who enjoys working, she does not like to be inactive, which is why she does not give up when there is lots of work to do. Her primary source of income comes from selling groceries and basic necessities. She sells rice, sugar, eggs, milk, salt, flour and other items.

Her customer base is primarily her neighbours who she serves with warmth. She has been running this business for 5 years and started selling from a little stall outside her home. Now she has a display window and a large space within her home that is dedicated to her shop. She works alone, or with her daughter's help. They also own 3 taxis, which they rent out on a daily basis and she works as a cleaner in a state institution.

She likes everything that she does and does not hesitate to put her best effort into carrying out her work with optimism every day. Her greatest wish is to improve the shop's infrastructure so she can display her products better and can sell more. This is her second loan with MFP, she is grateful for the opportunity and help that she has been offered to access the financing to help improve her work. She is committed to making her payments according to the payment schedule and hopes to keep working with the members of her communal bank.

The amount of 1500 PEN will be invested in buying wholesale groceries such as sugar, milk, rice and eggs that are in high demand from her customers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, rice and eggs as these are in greatest demand from her customers.

loans.name: Clary

texts.es:
Clary, de 37 años, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y muy carismática, convive con Laber y tiene 4 hijos menores de edad, vive junto a ellos en la casa propia que construyó con su pareja. Ahí aprendio a ser más fuerte con el paso de los años para sacar adelante a su familia.
Clary es una mujer que disfruta del trabajo, su fuente de ingreso principal consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi, tiene 1 vehículo que compró gracias a los préstamos que le han otorgado anteriormente y del que actualmente aún continua pagando. Lleva cerca de un año ejerciendo esta función, sin embargo realiza otras actividades que también le generan ingresos económicos como la venta de comida en un pequeño restaurante que acondicionó en su vivienda.
Todo lo que realiza le gusta mucho y no duda en poner su mayor esfuerzo para trabajar cada día con mucho optimismo, su gran deseo ahora es refaccionar su vehículo que por ahora tiene en estado de inactividad para hacerlo trabajar y complementar así su principal fuente de ingresos.
Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, está muy contenta el financiamiento que le están brindando ya que así se siente segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas tal como le programen, está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
El monto solicitado 1000 soles lo invertirá en el pago de su cuota que realiza mensualmente, debido a la adquisición del mototaxi que compró.
texts.en:
Clary, who is 37, is an enterprising, hardworking and very charismatic woman.  She lives with her partner Laber and her 4 young children in their own home, which was built by her partner.  As the years have gone by, she has learned to be stronger so as to support her family.  

Clary is a woman who enjoys work and her main source of income is her motorcycle taxi business.  She has 1 vehicle which she bought with the help of loans which were granted to her previously and has been plying her trade for almost a year.  However, she has other means of generating income, such as selling food in a small restaurant which she installed in her home.  She enjoys everything she does and always works with the utmost effort and enthusiasm.  

Now, her great ambition is to refurbish her vehicle, which is currently out of use, to get it up and running again and, in this way, supplement her main source of income.  

This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy with the funding which they provide because she feels confident about taking her business forward.  Furthermore, she guarantees that she will make her repayments as planned.  

She is very happy to belong to her communal bank because everyone is highly responsible and caring.  She will invest the sum requested (100 soles) in paying the monthly instalments for the purchase of her motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to pay the installment on her moto taxi

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha, de 48 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y amable, además de ser trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está casada con Jesús quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus hijos de 23 y 16 años de edad. Juntos habitan su propia casa en compañía de su padre. 
La actividad que tiene Martha es la venta de bebidas gaseosas de diferentes marcas y sabores, además de golosinas. Todos estos productos son adquiridos al contando y son vendidos desde su casa a sus vecinos y transeúntes quienes son sus clientes habituales. Tiene más de 06 años dedicándose  éste negocio y por el momento solo cuenta con el apoyo de su hija quien atiende a los clientes cuando ella está fuera de casa.
Le gusta su negocio por los ingresos económicos y el poder estar en la comodidad de su casa y contar con tiempo disponible para dedicarlos a otras actividades. Considera a su negocio rentable por la demanda que tiene y las ganancias que le deja. Por tanto tiene planes de ampliar su negocio e incursionar en la venta de comidas rápidas. Este será el préstamo número 05 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues le gusta el trabajo que vienen realizando apoyando a las personas.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para surtir su bodega, gaseosas y variedad de golosinas.
texts.en:
Martha is 48 years old and is a happy, friendly woman.  She’s also a hard worker with a desire to get ahead.  She’s married to Jesus who works as a driver and is the father of her children, ages 23 and 16.  They live in a home of their own with her father.

Martha sells soft drinks of different brands and flavors.  She also sells sweets and sells for cash out of her home to her neighbors and passersby.  She has been doing this for six years and has her daughter’s support, who serves customers while she is out of the house.

She likes her business because of the income and because she can be comfortably in her home and have spare time to dedicate to other activities.  She considers her business to be profitable because of the demand she has and the earnings she gets.  She plans to expand her business and begin selling fast food.  This will be her 5th loan though MFP and she is hoping for a small loan so she can meet her objectives.  She says that she feels comfortable with her communal bank because she likes the work.

She will use the 1,000 PEN from this loan to buy merchandise to stock her store with soft drinks and various snacks.
.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, de 69 años, es un hombre amable y trabajador, esta casado con Emma de 63 años y con quien tiene cinco hijos a quienes crió, educo y brindo siempre lo mejor hasta el momento que fueron mayores e independientes, el vive a lado de su esposa en su casa propia en donde trabaja a diario para poder mejorar su condicione de vida.
El trabajo de Roberto, consiste en la venta de productos naturales curativos, trabaja con una empresa internacional que le abastece de un novedoso y buen producto el cual contiene propiedades curativas y de consumo para todas edades. También se dedica a la venta de leña  compra troncos de árboles para luego cortarlos en trozos para su venta. Cuenta con la ayuda de los miembros de las familias todos los días él salen a las calle a ofrecer su producto. Lleva realizando dos años este trabajo que le permite tener tranquilidad y comodidad, antes tenia el trabajo de soldador pero con el tiempo el brillo de la soldadura deterioro su vista quedando en algún momento sin poder ver absolutamente nada, como siempre fue un hombre perseverante y fuerte hizo todo lo posible para poder recuperarse y ahora que esta mucho mejor, tiene una nueva forma de ganarse la vida.
Le va bien en su trabajo, en base a mucho esfuerzo logro hacerse de una buena cartera de clientes que le permite tener buenas ventas y con lo mismo mejorar sus ingresos, desea poder seguir trabajando y poder aumentar su cantidad de productos ya que cada día crecen mas la cantidad de clientes de su negocio. Este será el crédito número 04 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura d avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual ya que no desea quedar mal con su grupo ya que ahí son muy puntuales.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará mas productos naturales y troncos de árboles ya que tiene muchos pedidos de los distintos restaurantes de comidas típicas de la región.
texts.en:
Roberto, 69, is a nice, hardworking man married to Emma, 63; they had five children they raised to independent adulthood and always sought the best for.  He lives alongside his wife in his own house where he works every day to be able to improve their living conditions.

Roberto’s work consists in selling natural remedies.  He works with an international firm that supplies novel, good products that have curative properties and are designed to be consumed by people of all ages.  He also sells firewood.  He buys tree trunks to cut into pieces to be sold.  His family members help him by going out daily into the streets to sell his product.  He’s been doing this for two years and it gives him peace of mind and comfort.  He used to work as a welder but in time the bright light damaged his sight to such an extent that there was a time when he couldn't see anything at all.  Since he’s always been a persevering, strong man he did everything possible to recover and now he’s much better and has a new way of earning a livelihood.

He does well in his work.  Thanks to all his efforts he’s managed to acquire a good number of customers that leads to good sales and improved income.  He wants to continue working and increase the quantity of products because his customer base grows more every day.

This will be MFP loan #4 and he’s very happy to know that he’ll be able to rely on financial support because he’ll feel more confident about making business progress.  On the other hand, he commits to once again make his payments punctually because he does not want to disappoint his group which is very punctual.  He will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy natural products and tree trunks since he already has many pending orders from various restaurants that serve traditional, regional dishes.

loans.use: to buy more natural products and tree trunks.

loans.name: 4 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El comité 4 de Mayo se encuentra en el sexto ciclo. Está conformado por 12 mujeres con diferentes actividades, este grupo se formó a partir de promociones realizadas en la zona. Ellas son de la ciudad de Paraguarí.
Una persona digna de destacar es la Sra. Carolina, quien por medio de su venta de frutas esta saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia. Ella es una persona muy luchadora que desea el día de mañana poder tener una gran frutería para poder seguir trabajando.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frutas y así seguir dando a sus clientes buenas frutas frescas.
texts.en:
The "4 de Mayo" communal bank is on its sixth loan cycle.  The group is made up of twelve women, doing different types of work.  The group came together as a result of advertising in the area.  The women are from the city of Paraguarí.

One woman worth mentioning is Carolina who, through her fruit sales is prospering and helping her family.  She is a fighter and would soon like to have a big fruit shop to continue working.

She is applying for this loan to buy fruits so she can go on providing her customers with fresh fruits.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Halimakhon

texts.ru: Халимахон 35 лет. Она замужем, и мать четверых детей. Она честная, добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. У Халимахон собственная пекарня, где она вместе с мужем занимается выпеканием лепешек. Она занимаются этой деятельностью уже 10 лет. Чтобы расширить свой бизнес и увеличить свой доход, Халимахон обратилась за кредитом. Она просит кредит для покупки муки и топлива.
texts.en: Halimakhon is 35 years old. She is married and is a mother of four children. She is honest, kind and hardworking woman. Halimakhon has own bakery where she makes flat breads together with her husband. She has been in this business for ten years. To expand her business and increase income Halimakhon has asked for a loan. She is asking for a loan to buy flour and fuel.

loans.use: to buy flour and fuel.

loans.name: Guarani Group

texts.es:
El comité “Gurani” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, donde cada una pone todo de si para poder seguir trabajando y así ayudar a sus familias. Son mujeres jefas de familia que con su trabajo humilde y sacrificado quieren salir adelante.
Todas ellas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, patos, ovejas y demás, cuentan que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio tienen los medios para ayudar a sus hijos y cubrir los gastos del día a día.
Rosalva, una de ellas solicita de este crédito para la compra de balanceados parra sus animales, y así seguir trabajando y teniendo buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
The committee named “Guarani” was formed as a result of several neighbors from the city of Santaní joining together. Each member gives her best so that they can continue working and helping their families. These women are the heads of their families, so they work with humility and sacrifice in order to get ahead.

All of the members raise and sell domesticated animals such as chickens, ducks, sheep, and other livestock. By investing great effort and sacrifice, they have been able to help their children and cover their daily expenses.

Rosalva, one of the members, is requesting a loan in order to buy balanced feed for her animals. This will enable her to continue working and generating a good income.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишеру 27 лет. Он женат и имеет двух детей. Алишер один обеспечивает семью. Возле дома у него есть собственная пекарня, где он занимается проиводством лепешек. Он работает в этой сфере уже 8 лет. Алишер трудолюбивый и очень ответственный человек. Он просит кредит для покупки сырья для производства лепешек.
texts.en: Alisher is 27 years old. He is married and has two children. Alisher provides for his family himself. He has own bakery near his home where he makes flat breads. He has been working in this field for eight years. Alisher is a hardworking and very responsible man. He is asking for a loan to buy raw materials to make flat breads.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make flat breads.

loans.name: Ascencia

texts.es: La Sra. Ascencía sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de leche, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior credito incremento la produccion de leche con la vaca que compro, ahora en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de forraje para la laimentacion de su ganado, se siente feliz por esta nueva oportunidad ya que esta creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Ascencía continues her business of selling milk. She did very well with her previous loan since she was able to increase milk production with the cow she purchased.

On this occasion, she is requesting another loan so that she can buy fodder for feeding her cows. She is very pleased to have this new opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru: Рачабали проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 48 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Рачабали имеет среднее образование. Он предоставляет услугу. У него имеется собственная хлопкоочистительная фабрика, где он сам занимается этим делом. В этой области Рачабали 5 лет. Он берет кредит для расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Rajabali lives in the region of Hamadoni. He is 48 years old, married and has four children. Rajabali has secondary education. He provides a service. He owns a cotton processing factory and is in this business himself. Rajabali has been in this business for five years. He is taking out the loan to buy upgraded equipment.

loans.use: to buy an upgraded equipment.

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.es: Diomedes de 32 años, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 10 años de edad al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde se dedica al comercio de víveres, ranchos, refrescos y productos de la canasta familiar, entre familias que habitan principalmente alrededor de su tienda. Diomedes inició su negocio desde hace más de dos años en un local arrendado, porque su espíritu emprendedor, lo direccionaba hacia una actividad independiente en la que dejara de ser empleado y llegara a ser su propio jefe, como lo ha logrado en la actualidad, pues gradualmente ha ido comprando herramientas de trabajo, activos fijos, que hoy son de su propiedad. En su negocio vende diariamente y es atendido por él y su cónyuge, ambos tienen como meta futura, comprar el local donde están arrendados. Su mayor desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para cumplir rápidamente sus propósitos, de inversión en los artículos de mayor rotación en la tienda y en mayor cantidad, y poder disminuir la frecuencia de compras y ganar descuentos por invertir en volúmenes, de contado, generando así una mayor utilidad.  Diomedes aumentó sus inventarios y respondió a sus clientes con más variedad de productos, siente que su negocio ha crecido y esto es gracias a sus financiamientos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Él dice a esta organización: “Gracias por su apoyo que me ha servido de mucho, para mantener el negocio“.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un   credikiva, porque quiere aprovechar su ubicación, pues se encuentra  en una esquina muy transitada, para ubicar una venta de comidas rápidas y generar un nuevo ingreso por este concepto. Diomedes con su credikiva comprará salsas en mayor volumen, embutidos, carnes e insumos, para vender perros calientes, hamburguesas, chuzos y poco a poco agregará lo que su clientela  exija. Su inversión será exitosa, porque aprovechará el mercado actual y el potencial que transita diariamente por ese sector, además de que la hace en una temporada de carnaval, época en la cual se venden estos productos en una mayor cantidad.
texts.en: Diomedes, who is 32, lives with his wife and 10-year-old son south of the city of Barranquilla.  He runs a business selling food, snacks, soft drinks and basic household goods to families, the majority of whom live close to his shop.  Diomedes set up his business over two years ago in rented premises because, having an enterprising spirit, he felt drawn to self-employment where he would no longer be an employee and could be his own boss.  He has achieved this by gradually acquiring tools and fixed assets which he now owns.  His shop is open for business daily and is staffed by himself and his wife, both of whom share the ambition of buying the premises which they are currently renting.  His greatest challenge is not having sufficient working capital to achieve his goals.  These are to invest in stock with higher turnover, to buy in greater quantities, so as to reduce the frequency of his purchases and qualify for bulk cash purchase discounts.  As a result, he will be able to generate higher profits.  Having increased his buffer stock and delivered greater choice to his customers, and feels that his business has grown thanks to the funding he has received from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He has this message for the organisation: "Thank you for your support which has been a great help in allowing me to remain in business".  He is currently applying for a Kiva loan because he wants to take full advantage of his shop's very busy street-corner location by setting up a fast-food outlet to generate new income.  With the Kiva loan Diomedes will make purchases of sauces, sausages, meat and supplies for the sale of hotdogs, hamburgers and kebabs and he will gradually add other items for which there is a demand amongst his customers.  His investment will be successful because he will capitalise on the current market situation and the potential daily footfall.  Furthermore, he is making the investment during a carnival period, a time when such products sell in greater quantities.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of sauces, sausages, meat and supplies for the sale of hotdogs, hamburgers, kebabs

loans.name: Dambasuren

texts.en:
Dambasuren, 23 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on their plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2010 when he purchased an automobile by leasing from a bank. The automobile he uses for a taxi has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. 

So, he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase four amortisseur (shock absorbers), mastic (car wax) and to pay for a diagnosis. As a result, he can generate more income for his family. Dambasuren is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to repair his automobile.

loans.name: Jepopyhy Group

texts.es:
El Comite Jepopyhy  es del chaco, está en su sexto ciclo y están saliendo adelante  por medio del sacrificio de todas ellas. La Sra.   Lilian, una de las miembros se dedica a la venta  de ropas y cuenta que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante. Este negocio le ha ayudado a poder ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que necesitan para poder seguir creciendo.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, y así tener una buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes y seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Jepopyhy committee is from El Chaco. It is in its sixth cycle and they are getting ahead by the sacrifices they all make. Lilian is one of the members who sells clothes and says that with much hard work and sacrifice she is getting ahead. This business has helped her help her family and give them everything they need to be able to keep growing.  

She is asking for the loan to invest it in buying clothing so she can have a good variety to offer her customers and keep working like she has done so far.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Togsjargal

texts.en:
Togsjargal is a 49-year-old widow who lives with four of her children in an apartment in the Orhon province of Mongolia. Her daughters Bolortuya, aged 20, and Uuganbayar, aged 18, are university students and her twin sons Otgonbaatar and Otgonjargal, aged 13, go to a local school. Her two older children have graduated from university and live separately with their families. 

Togsjargal has been operating a toy store in the local market since 1998. She has many regular customers and imports toys from Erlian in China one or two times a month. She has paid for her children's university tuition and her working capital has decreased a lot, so she needs more investment to run her business smoothly. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to import more toys in order to run her business smoothly without pause. She is a hardworking, tough and welcoming woman.

loans.use: to import more toys for her business

loans.name: Badamtseren

texts.en:
Badamtseren, 35 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He studied in Turkey from 1999 to 2004 and since 2004 he has been running his own clothes sales business.  Beginning in 2010, he has been importing clothes from Turkey and selling them to local people. 

In 2013 he rented a restaurant and agreed to pay four months’ rental fees. But due to lack of finances, he couldn’t afford to pay the remaining fee so he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT. As a result, he can operate his restaurant without worrying about rental fees. 

As his businesses stabilize and begin to generate income, he can invest in his son’s education and his family’s well being. Badamtseren is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to pay rental fees for a restaurant.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El presente comite se formo por medio de una de las miembros y actualmente ya se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo gracias al trabajo de todas ellas.
La Sra Aida tiene 37 años de edad esta Casada con el Sr Calixto, juntos tienen 3 hijos.  La Sra Aida es vendedora ambulante de Planteras, y cuenta que todo el sacrificio que hace es para poder dar a su familia lo que pueda y también ayudar a su marido.
Solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en  comprar cerámica, pinturas, barro etc y así poder seguir vendiendo sus planteras.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by one of the members and now they are in their fourth cycle, thanks to all of their hard work.  

Aida is 37 years old. She is married to Calixto and they have 3 children together. Aida is a street vendor in Planteras, and she says that all of her sacrifices are to be able to give her family what she can and also to help her husband.
 
She is asking for the loan to invest it in buying ceramics, paint, clay etc. to keep selling her planters.

loans.use: to buy ceramics, paint, clay, etc.

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Nergui, 52 years old, lives with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. Her two sons are now working in the countryside. Nergui has been running a construction materials sales business and produces metal nails with the help of her sons. In the past eleven years, she has attracted quite a number of customers to her business and accumulated a vast amount of experience. 

She has been purchasing metals from local people in order to produce nails and now she is importing metals from China. As a result, her business profit will increase drastically because the price gap between local metal and metal in China is quite high. In the next one or two months, her business profit will be at its climax because construction field activity also intensifies. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials in large quantities. By doing so, she can generate more income for her children’s future education and life. Nergui has gotten loans from our organization several times and paid each loan on the established schedule without any delay.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials in large quantities.

loans.name: Tsedensodnom

texts.en:
Tsedensodnom, 53 years old, lives with her family in Dundgovi, in the southern province of Mongolia. The family lives in their own house on a plot of land. She and her husband raise livestock, and they are some of the best herdsmen in Mongolia. Their eldest daughter has a position of distributor at a catering company. Their second daughter works as a teller at a bank. Their third daughter is pregnant, and their youngest daughter studies at the university. 

Over the years the house they live in has deteriorated and needs some serious repair. Tsedensodnom is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials such as cement, gypsum and bricks. As a result the family can live in a comfortable and warm place. A renovated house has the benefits of not losing its heat easily and consuming less coal. Reducing the usage of coal will contribute to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, gypsum and bricks.

loans.name: Khanbaba

texts.en: Khanbaba is 51 years old. He is married and has four children. All his children live with him. He is engaged in agriculture and has 32 years of experience in this field. He is a farmer who has a small plot of land where he plants vegetables. He wants to develop the farm business. His difficulty is the lack of the necessary equipment to work the land. Kahnbaba is taking out a loan to cover his greenhouse with oilcloth.

loans.use: To buy oilcloth to cover his greenhouse.

loans.name: Buyannemeh

texts.en:
Buyannemeh is 43 years old and lives with her husband and 3 sons in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband, Purvee, and her older son, Gunchin, provide transportation services. Her younger sons, Davaahuu and Otgonhuu, are students in a specialty training school. 

She has been running her cobbler business in her home since 2006, and she has built close relationships with customers and suppliers over the years. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory to fill one big order from a regular customer (a retailer). She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to meet one big order from a regular customer.

loans.name: Serenidad Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Serenidad, se conformó en fecha 17 de enero del 2009, son 15 señoras y actualmente ya están en su ciclo numero 14.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, quien por medio de la venta de cazados ayuda a su familia. Cuenta Lidia que le esta yendo muy bien en su negocio ya que siempre tiene muy buenos calzados y eso gusta mucho a sus clientes. Su meta es poder tener un día una gran zapatería y seguir trabajando para su familia.
Solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de calzados de todo tipo y así cumplir con los pedidos que tiene de algunos clientes y también poder atraer a otros.
texts.en:
The 'Serenidad' Women's Committee was formed on January 17th, 2009.  The group has 15 female members who are currently in their 14th loan cycle.

One of the members of this group is Lidia, who helps her family by selling footwear.  She says that her business is doing very well as she always has very good footwear available and this pleases her customers a lot.  Her goal is to one day have a large shoe store and to keep working for her family.

Lidia is requesting this loan to invest in buying all kinds of footwear so that she can fill the orders that she has from some of her customers and also attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy footwear

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She has been operating a business of tailoring for three years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband alone works for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household along with the educational needs of the children. That is why she started sewing for the people living around her house, and she uses the income to support her entire family. 

She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She requested a loan of Rs. 25,000/- to purchase more reels of thread with packs of buttons and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand of her customers. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history. Shabana hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread with packs of buttons and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Kako

texts.en:
Kako is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of crockery sales for ten years with the support of her husband. She buys different types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls, etc. from the market at wholesale rates, and her husband assists her in selling them to the people of their community and in the local market. She makes a sufficient amount of profit to contribute to the family income. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs.10,000. In this way she will be able to purchase more of a variety of crockery, such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs, to cater more to customers' demands. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more of a variety of crockery, such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs, to cater more to customers' demands.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 4 children that range in age from 12 to 22 years. She describes herself to be humble and loving. She operates a farm stand and retail business where she sells maize, beans, cereals, mangoes etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a visible business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy cereals to sell. Her business goal is to be a supplier of cereals within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cereal to sell.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Ms. Nazia is 22-year-old unmarried woman. She has been doing hand-embroidery for the past 3 years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges combined with daily expenses frustrate her nearly every day. Her father is a laborer but earns insufficient income to support the needs of the family members. Nazia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 25000, to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She aspires to save money for her marriage and dowry preparation.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her embroidery business.

loans.name: Malem Nganbi Group

texts.en:
Malem Nganbi is a group comprised of five women members. All the members live in Yairipok Khoirom which is located about 24 kilometres from the capital Imphal, Manipur state, which is in North East India. Individually, there are many difficulties faced by a member in running the family. But after these women come together, somehow they are now able to find some better means of living and sustaining themselves.
	
Tamu, who is seen in the picture with her hand raised, is the profiled member. She is 54 years old. She has two sons and a daughter. Her sons have already left school and are now engaged as drivers. Her husband runs a motor workshop. Because of all the financial hardships they are facing, her sons have taken up jobs as drivers for earning just meager wages. Tamu too wants to have a share in supporting the family but due to lack of capital she could not.

She received a loan for the first time in 2011. With the loan amount she was able to buy two piglets and raise them. After twelve months, one of the pigs gave birth to nine piglets. After some days of nursing them, she then sold away the piglets. She made a good earning out of it. With the second loan, she invested some portion of it in expanding her husband’s motor workshop and with the remainder, she bought chicks. The workshop was well run and she too was successful in her poultry farming. Since she was able to pay back the two previous loans, she can now access the third loan with which she wants to buy four or five piglets, raise them again like she did with the first loan and sell the full-grown pigs for profit.

Likewise, the other members of the group utilise the loans for poultry, piggery and weaving. They too have successfully managed the funds and made good earning from the loan. In gratitude, all the members of the group wish the lenders success in helping out the needy.

loans.use: To buy four or five piglets to raise and sell full grown pigs for a profit

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 31-year-old married woman and a dedicated mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Najma’s husband, who has been running a donkey cart for five years. He transfers things from one place to another and makes a reasonable amount of income through his business to meet the family expenses. 

In order to purchase a bigger size wooden cart, Najma requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. In this way her husband would be able to carry more things at once, such as vegetables and fruits, to save his time. Najma expects a boost in her husband’s income and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger size wooden cart.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El Comité llamado Kuña Katupyry  actualmente se encuentra en el 2º ciclo son señoras con aspiraciones y deseos de trabajar, habitualmente todas se dedican en la venta y con el incentivo de generar ingresos para una buena calidad de vida.
 La Sra Severiana es una de las integrantes y cuenta que se dedica a las ventas, tiene una pequeña despensita en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas hasta muy tarde, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que quiere seguir creciendo y mejorar de a poco su negocio.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, verduras, frutas, lácteos y demás, para poder seguir teniendo bien surtido su negocio y dar así una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 'Kuña Katupyry' committee are currently in their second loan cycle.  These ladies all have aspirations and a desire to work.  They all work selling a various products and their goal is to make income so that they can enjoy a good quality of life.

Severiana is one of the members of this group.  She has a small grocery store in which she works every day, from very early in the morning until very late at night.  She is a very hard-working, entrepreneurial person who would like to keep growing and improving her business little by little.

Severiana is requesting this loan to invest in buying drinks, vegetables, fruit, dairy products, etc.  This will enable her to continue having a well-stocked business and she will be able to offer a good variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, vegetables, fruit, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband works as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

Balgees is the mother of five children, and among them two are school going. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy a stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. Then she would be able to meet with the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Lamjing Meira Group

texts.en:
Lamjing Meira is a group formed by ten members. All the members are women hailing from Yairipok Khoirom which is about 30 kilometres from Imphal, the capital of Manipur state, which is in the northeastern part of India. Each member has a big role in the family which one alone can hardly fulfill. So these women have come together to strengthen and sustain themselves by finding a solution.

Phajabi is the profiled member, the one who is posing with her hand raised in the picture. She is 46 years of age and has three sons and two daughters. Along with her husband, she has been doing whatever she can to support her family. Before she accessed any loan, she used to run a tea stall in the locality. The income generated from the stall was far less than what she needed for the family. She wanted to raise her income by doing some other business but she was helpless because she could not afford more capital.

In 2012, fortunately, she was able to start a better business after she received the first loan. With the loan amount she bought a hundred chicks and started a poultry farm, while she utilised some portion of the loan for buying oil, sugar, milk and other ingredients for the tea stall. This way she added another source of income which was possible solely because of the loan. With the next loan, she is planning to expand her poultry farming business by buying 200-250 chicks and 2-3 piglets. Likewise, the rest of the members also have successfully engaged themselves with piggery and poultry farming and weaving. 

Deep in her heart, Phajabi can already feel the joy when she thinks of herself and the other members being lifted to some height from the depth of all the hardships they had faced.

loans.use: To buy 200-250 chicks and 2-3 piglets and raise them for sale

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 42-year-old married man. He has 5 children that range in age from 10 to 25 years. He describes himself to be an honest, focused and determined man. He operates a retail shop where he sells household items and vegetables such as onions, potatoes, bread, soda, tea leaves, cooking fat, sugar etc. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a visible business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances to expand his business. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy household items and vegetables. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved his business with a goal of making 200,000 profit monthly. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. He previously took a loan of KES 40,000 which he paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy household items and vegetables.

loans.name: Las Merceditas Group

texts.es:
El comité  las Merceditas se conformó en fecha  24  de setiembre 2008  con mucho esfuerzo ya  se encuentran en el 10 ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa, todas se ayudan y están saliendo adelante. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar  a sus familias .
Una historia es la de la Sr: Secundina quien se dedica a la venta de sabanas, colchas y almohadones argentinos esto gracias a los créditos que se le otorgó, nos comenta que pudo mejorar su actividad y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de sabanas, colchas y demás productos para poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia por medio de ese trabajo que viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Merceditas" was formed on September 24, 2008. With much hard work, it is now in its 10th loan cycle, working jointly and with solidarity within the program. All of the members help each other, and they are making progress. In addition to each member's independent work, they also undertake joint activities, and they provide mutual help to reach their aim of working hard to support their families. 

One story is that of Secundina, who dedicates herself to selling sheets, bedspreads and decorative pillows from Argentina. Thanks to the loans that have been granted to her, she comments that she was able to improve her work, her standard of living and her income.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in buying sheets, bedspreads and other products, so that she can keep working and helping her family through this work which she is doing.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a married man. He has 2 children aged 4 and 12 years. He describes himself to be an honest, God-fearing and ambitious man.

He operates a retail store where he sells scrap metals. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located at a viable business and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy scrap metals to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will improve his business with a goal of making a profit of 10,000 KES monthly. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy scrap metals to sell

loans.name: Gadir

texts.en:
Gadir is married and the father of two schoolchildren. He is 45 years old. Gadir has a high school education.
He raises livestock and earns money by raising cattle, selling milk products and meat. Gadir is taking out a loan to purchase construction materials to build his house. He wants to move to his own house and start increasing his livestock count. This will allow him to expand milk production and increase the amount of milk products he can sell.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building his house.

loans.name: Wake - Up Group

texts.en:
Yohana who is in his early 40s is married with four children who are still going to school. He has been running a business of selling iron sheets since 2008. 

He works from 6.00 AM to 6.00 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy soft sheets for making iron suitcases (normally used by school children).  In addition he used part of the loan for household expenses, and school fees.  He has paid back his loan successfully. He is requesting a loan to buy more iron sheets and to make more suitcases to sell. He has a dream of opening another iron sheets shop in a different area.

He will share this loan with his loan group "WAKE - UP" that consists 5 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more iron sheets in order to make more suitcases to sell.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 39-year-old divorced woman. She has 2 children ages 9 and 15 years old. She describes herself to be a humble and caring woman.

She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances for improving the business.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy hair beauty products. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children as her husband divorced her and she is the sole provider of the family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy hair beauty products

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Las Triunfadoras fue creado con  la idea de ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo que hacen todas las miembros como grupo. Son mujeres jefas de familia que se esfuerzan mucho por salir adelante e ir creciendo.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Perla, quien vende frutas y verduras, se define a si misma como una persona luchadora que ha podido salir adelante con su esfuerzo y trabajo. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras, para así seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
Todas ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, ya que les será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir trabajando y ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The 'Las Triunfadoras' committee was created with the idea of all the members helping each other through the work that they carry out as part of the group.  The members are all heads of families who work hard to get ahead and continue making progress.

One of the members of this group is Perla, who sells fruit and vegetables.  She describes herself as a tenacious person who has been able to make progress thanks to all her efforts and hard work.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying fruit and vegetables so that she can continue working and helping her family.  All of the members of the group are grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving as it will be a great help to them in enabling them to continue working and helping their families.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Nupi Chaokhat Marup Group

texts.en:
These women called themselves “Nupi Chaokhat” and its meaning is ‘Empowered women’. Their coming together as a group, proves all the more for their perseverance to add to their credit. They all belong to a non-tribal community and live in Manipur state in the North Eastern part of India.

The profiled member Sunita is featured with her hand raised. She is 38 years old and a mother to two sons and a daughter, who is married already. Her husband is a driver by profession. Both her sons are still school-going students in a private school nearby. In order to supplement the family income she has been weaving and also earning by undertaking strenuous work like sand sieving by the river bank. This is how she earned income before taking out a loan.

In 2010, with the loan she ventured into a new business of selling indigenous dried fish. In other words, she sells fermented fish in varieties. From the sale proceeds she was able to repay her loan. It also enabled her to refill her stock of dry fish to sell. She is happy that with her contribution she can save her husbands income more for the family. With steady improvement she has been buying her stock to sell for a profit. She says that the hardship she faces in her business is when it rains. In order to overcome this obstacle she means to construct a stall for her business. For now, she has to continue selling on the roadside till she can arrange enough money to construct a stall. 

With limited capital she has been earning less. In order to save more she cut down on the family expenditures such as instead of using two mobiles she insisted her husband use just one mobile for the family. In this way she has been saving INR 500 on a monthly basis and invested the same with local investors to be managed locally. In order to do better with her dry and fermented fish selling business she needs another loan.

With this loan Sunita wishes to increase her stock of indigenous dry and fermented fish to sell. Her stocks include dried salted fish, dried fish of varied sorts and fermented fish (in local dialect known as thumjakpi, fafou, ngari, ngajai, moreh ngaton). These products are among the main dishes in every household in this part of the country. Likewise, the rest of the group members also need another loan to continue with their respective income-generating activities like weaving, quarrying and sand sieving.

loans.use: To increase her stock of indigenous fermented fish to sell for a profit

loans.name: Priscilar

texts.en:
Priscilar is a 56-year-old married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 22 to 34 years. She describes herself to be a dynamic woman.

She operates a poultry business where she sells chickens. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located near a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds to improve the business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy poultry. Her business goal is to be a supplier of chickens within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy poultry food

loans.name: Waefeso Group

texts.en:
Fransis, who is in his mid-30s, is married with one son who is still at school. He has been selling soft drinks for two years now. He works from 10:00 AM to 9:00 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Fransis's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to pay school fees, cover household expenses and restock missing soft drinks.  He has paid back all his loans successfully. He will use the required loan to buy more stock of soft drinks to resell. He has a dream of building his own house.

Fransis will share this loan with his loan group "WAEFESO," which has 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luis, es comerciante, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, tiene un negocio de venta equipos electrónicos (parlantes, búfer, cornetas, radios, auto radio, pendrive, y otros equipos varios), trabaja de lunes a sábado, y cuenta que es muy conocido en la zona, se hizo de muy buena clientela gracias a que siempre tiene lo que sus clientes necesitan.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de parlantes, búfer, cornetas, radios y otros, para poder seguir trabajando y dando buena variedad a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo ya que le será de muy buena ayuda.
texts.en:
Luis is a merchant, and he lives in the city of Pilar.  He has a business selling electronic equipment (speakers, buffers, woofers, radios, car radios, flash drives, and various other pieces of equipment).  He works Monday through Saturday, and he is very well-known in the area.  He has gotten a very good clientele thanks to the fact that he always has what his customers need.

He is requesting the loan to buy speakers, buffers, woofers, radios, and others.  He will do this in order to be able to continue working and giving his customers a good variety.  He is grateful for the opportunity that he is receiving because it will be a big help to him.

loans.use: to buy speakers, buffers, woofers, radios, and others.

loans.name: Tellem Leikai Group

texts.en:
Tellem Leikai group has nine women members who are residents of Yairipok Khoirom village, a valley located about 24 kilometres from Imphal, capital of Manipur which is one of the states in North East India. Most of the members are illiterate but hard working and supportive to one another.

Tejamala, with raised hand as seen in the picture, is the profiled member. She is 37, a mother to two sons. Her husband is a government employee at the lowest grade with a small salary. She assists her husband in raising the family by engaging herself in sand sieving and weaving to add some income for the family.

In 2012, she focused more on weaving. She made different types of ‘wrap-rounds’, a typical cloth covering the legs from the waist which is worn by women (as seen in the picture). This type of cloth can be woven by hand as well as on a  handloom (weaving machine used manually). As preferred by many, she weaves by hand. Some are bordered with silk in different designs while some with synthetic thread. When she accesses this loan, she plans to increase the quantity of her products by engaging more weavers.

Likewise, the other group members are engaged in weaving and the products are supplied and sold at different marketplaces.

loans.use: To buy yarn for making ‘wrap-round’ skirts worn by women

loans.name: San Jorge Group

texts.es:
El comité San  Jorge se formo con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad de San Pedro. Todas la Integrantes del comité desarrollan la misma actividad, que es la cría y venta de animales, y por medio de ese trabajo ayudan a sus familias.
Geronina es una de estas mujeres, ella es muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y cuenta que por medio de su arduo trabajo está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia. Solicita este crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The committee San Jorge is the result of the union of several women neighbors in the San Pedro's community. All of the committee's members work in the breeding and sale of animals and are able to support their families thanks to this job.

Geronima is one of these women. She is a very hard-working person with an entrepreneurial spirit who, thanks to her arduous job, is getting ahead and providing for her family. She will use the requested loan to buy balanced food for her animals so that she can continue working and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced food for animal sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
El comité “MUJER AL PODER” se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, tiene 17 integrantes que se esfuerzan por salir adelante e ir creciendo. Todas las señoras del comité se esfuerzan día a día para poder brindarles a sus familias un mañana distinto del que a ellas tocó vivir.
Nelly es integrante de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de helados de todos los sabores y tipos, cuenta que gracias a su trabajo ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan para poder salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar helados y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas, ya que estamos en el tiempo que más calor hace y quiere seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Mujer al Poder group is in their fourth cycle with the women entrepreneurs program.  There are 17 members of the group who make an effort to improve themselves and grow.  All of the women in the group work hard every day to provide their families with a better future than what they have lived.  

Nelly is a member of the group.  She works selling all types and flavors of ice cream.  She says that her work helps her family and gives them everything they need to be able to improve themselves.

She is requesting this loan to purchase ice cream so that she can continue with her sales now that the temperature is warmer.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Unidas Para Mejorar Group

texts.es:
Las 12 integrantes de este grupo se unieron con el objetivo de ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio de ese trabajo salir adelante. El grupo lleva por nombre “Unidas para mejorar” ya que todas ellas se unieron para ayudarse y mejorar su calidad de vida.
